III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Agency was provided technical assistance relative to tools utilized to monitor
report due dates. The current tools utilized resulted in reports consistently being
one day late. The pattern was recognized and the agency is committed to making
adjustments to monitoring tools to ensure timely report completion.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency did not require consultation at this time.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
The agency did not have any incidents of Maltreatment in Care during this
reporting period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 5 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001333 with CAP approval date of 07/10/2024 was
the result of a violation for staff pulling and pushing a resident and placing their
hand in the face of a resident. The agency addressed the issue with the staff and
provided refresher training for all staff. The agency is currently complying with the
CAP action steps.
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001529 with CAP approval date of 09/25/2024 was
the result of a violation of agency policy; staff brought a weapon onto agency
property. The staff was terminated, policy updated and refresher training provided
to staff. The agency has complied with the CAP action steps.
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001790 with CAP approval date of 02/13/2025 was
the result of a violation for staff failing to dispense medication as prescribed. The
agency addressed the issue with training for the staff and hiring of a nurse
manager for increased oversite and monitoring. The agency is currently
complying with the CAP action steps.
Special Investigation 2025SIC0000054 with CAP approval date of 02/13/2025 was
the result of a violation for staff failing to follow agency policy and taking youth off
grounds without supervisor permission. The agency addressed the issue with
training of staff and review of policy. The agency is currently complying with the
CAP action steps.
Special Investigation 2025SIC000407 with CAP approval date of 04/23/2025 was
the result of a violation for staff pushing a youth. The agency addressed the issue
with the termination of the staff and refresher training for staff. The agency is
currently complying with the CAP action steps.
The agency also has three additional special investigations that are pending.
Financial Overview
The appropriate documents and audit were provided for review. The agency was
found to be financially stable and no areas of concern were noted.
3

PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. Chief administrator reported
since the last reporting period, the agency has continued to work on increasing
staffing and improved training of staff. The agency continues to utilize Therapeutic
Crisis Intervention (TCI) behavior management model and are providing training to
staff annually and refreshers as required or deemed necessary. The agency has
also shared information relevant to a new job description offered for experienced
staff to assist with the appropriate one to one monitoring of identified youth.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Six staff were interviewed during the onsite visit for the interim review. No issues or
concerns were noted. Staff spoke positively about employment with the agency.
A total of six youth were interviewed as a part of the interim review. Overall the
youth reported feeling safe at the agency and referenced good rapport and
relationship with staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through was completed at the agency and the agency was found to be in
good condition. No areas of concern were noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules.
